title: Fatigue Risk Management
content: Fatigue risk management treats fatigue as an organizational safety issue, not a personal weakness. It includes scheduling practices, workload limits, rest requirements, self-reporting systems, and fatigue-proofing procedures. Both organization and individual have responsibilities.

mcq.question: An operator reports they're too fatigued to continue safely. What should happen?

options.A: They should power throughâ€”everyone gets tired
options.B: Relief should be arranged without negative consequences for reporting
options.C: Performance metrics should determine if they can continue
options.D: Fatigue is a personal issue to manage privately

mcq.explanation: Fatigue self-reporting requires organizational support. If reporting leads to punishment or pressure, people stop reporting and work impaired. Effective systems make it safe to report and have contingencies ready.
